page.title: 07Watford: Watford F.C.
page.content: In 1891 West Herts and Watford St. Mary's Football Clubs amalgamated to form Watford Football Club. The Vicarage Road ground was bought by Benskins in 1921 and leased to Watford Football Club. The capacity of the ground is 28,462. Graham Taylor, the manager, took Watford from the fourth division in 1977 to the first division in 1982. Watford F.C. have a special terrace and enclosure for families, the only one in the country. Watford have never won an F.A. Cup Final but in 1984 they lost 2-0 in the final to Everton F.C. Elton John is Watford's Chairman, he has spent millions of pounds on the club and he has helped buy players. Elton John is well known all around the world because of his singing.
